channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Are Your Data Governance and Management Practices Keeping Pace with the AI Boom?
item.description: No matter how sophisticated and expensive a firm's AI tools are, it should not forget that the principle “garbage in, garbage out” (GIGO) applies to the entire investment management process.

item.title: New law in Iowa allows 14-year-olds get a driver’s license
item.description: Minors allowed to ferry themselves to work and school.

item.title: Book Review: Default
item.description: Argentina’s debt restructuring tests the theoretical limits of chaos theory. Gregory Makoff's feat is to build his narrative as a thriller without losing the detailed facts valued by specialists.

item.title: Planning decision for London’s controversial ‘Undershaft’ skyscraper delayed as objections mount over the city’s tallest tower
item.description: The chairman of Lloyd's of London complained the skyscraper would rob London of an important public square.

item.title: Conundrum Cubed: Scope 3 for Financials
item.description: Proxy data and estimates are likely to play an important role in plugging disclosure gaps in financial institutions' Scope 3 emissions.

item.title: Wingstop’s U.K. sober millennial chief walks to work from his Hampstead Heath apartment and has $25 lunches from London’s hottest luxury gym
item.description: Tom Grogan tells Fortune how he lives his “Good Life” from what he spends his bonus money on to his go-to $25 lunch order.

item.title: Hedge Funds: A Poor Choice for Most Long-Term Investors?
item.description: By allocating to a diversified pool of hedge funds, many institutional investors are unwittingly reducing their equity holdings.

item.title: 8 best secured credit cards to help build or repair your credit
item.description: We compared dozens of secured credit cards across numerous financial institutions and weighed minimum account deposits, annual fees, credit limits, rewards, and more.

item.title: Did Inflation Kill the CAPM?
item.description: While the immediate future may not be promising for the equity premium, it looks bright for factor premiums.

item.title: Ken Griffin is hitting pause on the AI hype, saying he’s unconvinced the tech will start replacing jobs in the next 3 years
item.description: “For a number of reasons, I am not convinced that these models will achieve that type of breakthrough in the near future.”
